item.title: 2019-2020 Investment Plan Update for the Alternative and Renewable Fuel and Vehicle Technology Program
item.description:
Kenneth,

Site .net looks ACADEMIC!!!  Great Job,

Is this the portal to move Curriculum out?

Is there a Strategy to advance the knowledge range of the group.?  Target Population (social media tools)   

Electrifying the transportation system is good.  How can an economy be built on this with help from CEC?  

This is the thread you attached your link to.


On Fri, Feb 8, 2019, 9:14 AM Kenneth Wyrick <kmw@caltek.net wrote:
would you please propose a budget to produce a series of month to month
activities (3 to 6 mo long) that would engage the watts community in the
investment plan and alternatives to be initiated at BioDiversity EarthDay
2019?

thank you.

are there minutes from either of the 2 weekly http://wcaec.net meetings?

I also still need to see the organizational designation paper work that
represents the WCAEC so that I have first hand knowledge to be able to
answer questions about it.



On Thu, February 7, 2019 6:29 pm, Michael Rendler wrote:
https://youtu.be/daSdmklUHlY

Important Budget Alotments 2019 2020 ARFVTP.   $100 MILLION PER
YEAR.through 2024.  AB 8. (Perea)

Following California Sustainable Freight Action Plan.

200 Hydrogen Stations (12 in disadvantaged NEIGHBORHOODS)

See Executive Order B-48-18

This is all targeted to support Diversity by putting technology in
DisAdvantaged areas.

This is why HUD Created a SLATEZ South Los Angeles Empowerment Zone.  Using
transportation technology as a seed for INNOVATION.

CENTURY BLVD.  THE CORRIDOR  NFL STADIUM TO JORDAN DOWNS. BOOK ENDS.

item.title: Watts Learning Center / Watts Clean Air and Energy Committee.
item.description:
I spoke with Dr. Lancer, yesterday, regarding Watts Learning Center and association with Watts Clean Air and Energy Committee. 

They have a program Learning Forum.

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/zrtcy2xgng6rlc2/AABd2V2HuOp5kwEUfP7BMcC6a?dl=0. (All relative docs here)

I think this as a component of WCA&EC Education subcommittee could be very helpful.

Included in this email are a set of talking points I discussed with Dr. Lancer.
